title: Your Monday Briefing: China’s Post-Covid Economic Goal
description: Also, Russia tries to cut off Bakhmut, and countries reach an ocean biodiversity deal.

title: What Trench Warfare on Ukraine’s Front Line Looks Like
description: The Ukrainian military calls it the zero position, where Russian soldiers are close enough to see, and where an old war tactic takes a horrific toll.

title: The Story of Multicultural Canada, Told in Humble Strip Mall Eateries
description: Some of Toronto’s best dining options are mom-and-pop shops little known beyond their immigrant patrons, offering dishes that recall tastes from home or fuse new flavors together.

title: What’s Your Workplace Personality?
description: Who should work at home, and who should return to the office? Companies are turning to personality tests for help.

title: Ukraine Holds Off Russian Forces in Bakhmut As Fighting Intensifies
description: Russian troops and Wagner mercenaries are still waging a fierce battle to encircle the eastern Ukrainian city, officials said.

title: They’re Exporting Billions in Arms. Just Not to Ukraine.
description: As traditional weapons suppliers like the U.S. face wartime production shortages, South Korea has stepped in to fill the gap, while trying not to provoke Moscow.

title: How A.I. Is Being Used to Detect Cancer That Doctors Miss
description: Hungary has become a major testing ground for A.I. software to spot cancer, as doctors debate whether the technology will replace them in medical jobs.

title: After China’s Winter of Discontent, Xi Jinping Sets Sights on Growth and Power
description: China’s government said it expected the economy to grow “around 5 percent” this year. A meeting of the top legislature will reinforce Mr. Xi’s grip on power.

title: U.S. Sanctions Relief for Syrian Regime Troubles Assad Opponents
description: Washington has temporarily eased sanctions on the authoritarian government of President Bashar al-Assad to allow humanitarian aid to flow freely after a disastrous earthquake struck Syria.

title: After China’s Winter of Discontent, Xi Jinping Sets Sights on Growth and Power
description: China’s government said it expected the economy to grow “around 5 percent” this year. A meeting of the top legislature will reinforce Mr. Xi’s grip on power.

title: Nations Agree on Language for Historic Treaty to Protect Ocean Life
description: The United Nations agreement is a significant step toward protecting biodiversity under growing threat from climate change, overfishing and mining of seabeds.

title: China’s Economy Will Expand About 5 percent, A Cautious Target
description: Last year China’s economy grew 3 percent, one of its worst performances. Now leaders are expecting a revival, but it will rely partly on public spending.
